question: Which type of sarcoma has been associated with members of the oral microbiome?
ideal_answer: Alterations in the oral microbiota in the immunosuppressed population may be associated with diseases such as Kaposi's sarcoma.

snippets.text: Alterations in the oral microbiota may be associated with disorders such as gingivitis, periodontitis, childhood caries, alveolar osteitis, oral candidiasis and endodontic infections. In the immunosuppressed population, the spectrum of potential oral disease is even broader, encompassing candidiasis, necrotizing gingivitis, parotid gland enlargement, Kaposi's sarcoma, oral warts and other diseases.
